headline.print_headline: Consumer Spending Rises as Jobless Claims Hold Steady
headline.seo: Consumer Spending Rises as Jobless Claims Hold Steady
headline.main: Consumer Spending Rises as Jobless Claims Hold Steady

docs.snippet: New data showed that economic and job growth remained modest, raising hopes for more Fed stimulus....
docs.abstract: Commerce Department reports consumer spending increased 0.4 percent in July after a flat reading in June; Labor Department reports first-time applications for state unemployment benefits were unchanged in the previous week at 374,000.
docs.lead_paragraph: New data showed that economic and job growth remained modest, raising hopes for more Fed stimulus.

headline.print_headline: Storm Weakens but Still Is Wreaking Watery Havoc in South
headline.seo: Hurricane Isaac Weakens but Continues to Wreak Watery Havoc
headline.main: Rain From Isaac Puts Wide Area at Risk

docs.snippet: The storm’s once fierce winds slowed to 45 miles per hour on Thursday as it moved out of southern Louisiana and headed north, still bringing heavy rains and flooding....
docs.abstract: Tropical Depression Isaac is weakening as it moves out of southern Louisiana and heads north, but is still bringing heavy rains and flooding.

byline.original: By JOHN SCHWARTZ and CAMPBELL ROBERTSON
byline.contributor: John Schwartz reported from Baton Rouge, La., and Campbell Robertson from Amite City, La. David Their contributed reporting from Plaquemines Parish, La.

docs.lead_paragraph: The storm’s once fierce winds slowed to 45 miles per hour on Thursday as it moved out of southern Louisiana and headed north, still bringing heavy rains and flooding.

headline.print_headline: Summit Meeting in Iran Disrupted by Rebukes of Syria
headline.seo: As Iranian Hosts Watch, Egyptian and U.N. Leaders Rebuke Syria
headline.main: Summit Meeting in Iran Disrupted by Rebukes of Syria

docs.snippet: At a meeting of world leaders in Iran, President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt denounced the repression of the armed uprising in Syria, a close Iranian ally....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Iran's triumphal stewardship of the Nonaligned Movement summit meeting in Tehran veers off script when Egyptian Pres Mohamed Morsi and United Nations secretary general Ban Ki-moon denounce the repression of the armed uprising in Syria, a close Iranian ally.

byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Mayy El Sheikh contributed reporting from Cairo, and Kareem Fahim from Beirut, Lebanon.

docs.lead_paragraph: At a meeting of world leaders in Iran, President Mohamed Morsi of Egypt denounced the repression of the armed uprising in Syria, a close Iranian ally.

headline.print_headline: Dozens Missing After Asylum Seekers’ Boat Sinks
headline.seo: Scores Missing After Australia-Bound Refugee Boat Sinks
headline.main: Scores Missing After Australia-Bound Refugee Boat Reports Distress

docs.snippet: About 100 people remained missing in what could be the largest loss of life this year for asylum seekers from the Middle East and Asia trying to reach Australia by sea....
docs.abstract: At least 90 people remain missing after a boat carrying about 150 migrants sank off Indonesia, the latest in a series of disasters for asylum seekers from the Middle East and Asia trying to reach Australia by sea.
docs.lead_paragraph: About 100 people remained missing in what could be the largest loss of life this year for asylum seekers from the Middle East and Asia trying to reach Australia by sea.

headline.seo: 5 Soldiers’ Deaths in Afghanistan Mark Australia’s Worst Toll Yet

docs.snippet: Five Australian troops were killed in Afghanistan within hours of each other, making it the single worst period in a decade of fighting here for one of the United States’ staunchest allies....
docs.abstract: Five Australian soldiers are killed in southern Afghanistan within hours of one another, three of them at the hands of a turncoat Afghan soldier, making it the deadliest period in a decade of fighting in the country for one of the United States' staunchest allies.

byline.original: By RICHARD A. OPPEL Jr. and MATT SIEGEL
byline.contributor: Richard A. Oppel Jr. reported from Kabul, and Matt Siegel from Sydney, Australia. Graham Bowley contributed reporting from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan.

docs.lead_paragraph: Five Australian troops were killed in Afghanistan within hours of each other, making it the single worst period in a decade of fighting here for one of the United States’ staunchest allies.
